benchmark_details.name: CodeAssistBench (CAB)
benchmark_details.overview: CodeAssistBench (CAB) is a benchmark framework for evaluating multi-turn programming assistance in realistic settings, using real-world questions derived from GitHub issues to test the capabilities of large language models in programming tasks.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the effectiveness of large language models in providing multi-turn programming assistance based on real-world scenarios.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: A limited number of programming languages are covered, and it does not currently assess proprietary codebases.

data.source: GitHub issues derived from public repositories.
data.annotation: Automatically generated through filtering and structured data extraction methods.

methodology.calculation: Metrics are calculated based on correctness and appropriateness of responses provided by models.
methodology.interpretation: Responses are assessed for correctness in technical answers and overall user satisfaction during interactions.
methodology.validation: Evaluation triggered when a user expresses satisfaction or the conversation reaches a maximum of 10 turns.

targeted_risks.harm: Potential risks include reliance on AI suggestions leading to bugs or security issues.
